tit.e: Shoden (the privilege of entering denjo no ma [denjo room] of the Imperial Palace)
tit.cmt: タイトルを補足しました。
tit.e: Shoden (the privilege of entering denjo no ma [denjo room] of the Imperial Palace)

sen.j: 昇殿（しょうでん）とは、平安時代以降に五位以上の者および六位蔵人の職にある者が内裏清涼殿の南廂にある殿上の間に昇ることを許されること。
sen.e: Shoden referred to having/giving permission to enter a denjo no ma (denjo room) in the minami-hisashi of the dairi-seiryo-den to people higher than goi (Fifth Rank) in the rank and people in a position of Rokui-Kurodo in and after the Heian period.

Shoden referred to having/giving permission to enter a denjo no ma in the minami hisashi (southern surrounding area) of the seiryoden of dairi (Imperial Palace) to people higher than goi (Fifth Rank) in the rank and people in a position of Rokui no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) in and after the Heian period.
sen.cmt: (denjo room)の補足はタイトルに使用したため、ここでは削除しました。「南廂」の意味を補足しました。ハイフンを削除しました。 「内裏」dairi (Imperial Palace) としました。「六位蔵人」訳語変更しました。
sen.e: Shoden referred to having/giving permission to enter a denjo no ma in the minami hisashi (southern surrounding area) of the seiryoden of dairi (Imperial Palace) to people higher than goi (Fifth Rank) in the rank and people in a position of Rokui no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) in and after the Heian period.

sen.j: 宇多天皇の頃より、天皇の日常の居所が清涼殿に定着化され、儀式や公事への参加あるいは天皇に近侍して身辺の雑用や宿直・陪膳などの職務を行うためには昇殿は欠かせないものであった。
sen.e: From Emperor Uda era emperors' daily whereabouts were fixed in the Seiryoden, therefore, shoden should not be missed in participating in ceremonies and public duties or dealing with emperor's personal affairs as an attendant and carrying out his duties such as night watch/waiting on the emperor on table.

From Emperor Uda era emperors' daily whereabouts were fixed in the Seiryoden, therefore, shoden was indispensable for participating in ceremonies and public duties or dealing with emperor's personal affairs as an attendant and carrying out his duties such as night watch/waiting on the emperor on table.
sen.cmt: should not be missed in→was indispensable for としました。
sen.e: From the era of Emperor Uda, the emperor's daily whereabouts were fixed in the Seiryoden; therefore, shoden was indispensable for enabling those of suitable rank to participate in ceremonies and public duties or deal with the emperor's personal affairs in their capacity as an attendant and carry out duties such as taking the night watch or waiting on the emperor at table.

sen.j: 昇殿は天皇の代替わりごとに選定が行われ、昇殿宣旨（しょうでんのせんじ）と呼ばれる宣旨を受けて、殿上の間に備えられた簡（札）に氏名が記されることで昇殿が認められ、必要に応じて殿上の間に詰めることが許されていた。
sen.e: The selection of shoden was made with changes of emperors, and selected persons, after receiving a senji (imperial decree) called a shoden no senji and having their names written on a board, were given shoden permission and allowed to stay in a denjo no ma if necessary.

The selection of shoden was made with each change of emperor, and selected persons, after receiving a senji (imperial decree) called shoden no senji and having their names written on a kan (board), were given shoden permission and allowed to stay in a denjo no ma if necessary.
sen.cmt: with changes of emperors→with each change of emperor としました。スペースを削除しました。a を削除しました。「簡」は後の訳文で "kan" として出ているため、board→kan (board) としました。
sen.e: The selection of shoden was made with each change of emperor, and selected persons, after receiving a senji (imperial decree) called shoden no senji and having their names written on a kan (board), were given shoden permission and allowed to stay in a denjo no ma if necessary.

sen.j: また、太上天皇や女院、中宮や東宮もそれぞれの御所においても独自の昇殿を行っていた。
sen.e: Daijo Tenno (retired emperors), nyoin (women bestowed with the title "in", chugu (empresses) and togu (crown prince) also had their own shoden in their imperial palaces.

Daijo Tenno (retired emperors), nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing), chugu (empresses) and togu (crown prince) also had their own shoden system in their imperial palaces.
sen.cmt: 「女院」訳語変更しました。) を追加しました。system を追加しました。
sen.e: Daijo Tenno (retired emperors), nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing), chugu (empresses) and togu (crown prince) also had their own shoden system in their imperial palaces.

sen.j: これらは内裏への昇殿が認められた内殿上人よりは格下とみなされていた。
sen.e: These people were regarded as lower in rank than naitenjobito who were allowed to enter the dairi, however, with the start of the Insei (rule by a retired emperor) period intenjobito were put before naitenjobito partly because actual government affairs were transferred to the Incho.
These people were regarded as lower in rank than naitenjobito who were allowed to enter the dairi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These people were regarded as lower in rank than naitenjobito who were allowed to enter the dairi.

sen.j: しかし院政期に入ると実際の政務の場が院庁に移ったこともあり、院殿上人の方が重んじられるようになった。
sen.e: However, with the start of the Insei (rule by a retired emperor) period, intenjobito (people who were granted shoden for retired emperor's palace) were put before naitenjobito partly because actual government affairs were transferred to In no cho (Retired Emperor's Office).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処コンマを追加しました。「院殿上人」を補足しました。「院庁」訳語変更しました。
sen.e: However, with the start of the Insei (rule by a retired emperor) period, intenjobito (people who were granted shoden for retired emperor's palace) were put before naitenjobito partly because actual government affairs were transferred to In no cho (Retired Emperor's Office).

sen.j: 公卿は原則的に昇殿が許され、また四位の参議は議政官の一員として例外的に公卿に準じた扱いが認められていた。
sen.e: Kugyo were generally given shoden, and Sangi (councillors) in the shii (Fourth Rank) were treated as members of Giseikan (Legislature) exceptionally as equally as kugyo.
Kugyo (high court noble) were generally given shoden, and Sangi (councilors) in the shii (Fourth Rank) were treated equally with kugyo exceptionally as members of Giseikan (Legislature).
sen.cmt: councillors→councilors 米国スペルとしました。「公卿」を補足しました。語順を変え、as equally as→equally with としました。
sen.e: Kugyo (high court noble) were generally given shoden, and Sangi (councilors) in the shii (Fourth Rank) were treated equally with kugyo exceptionally as members of Giseikan (Legislature).

sen.j: 両者を合わせて上達部（かんだちめ）と称する。
sen.e: Both of them, put together, were called kandachime (court nobles).
Both of them were collectively called kandachime (court nobles).
Both of them were collectively called kandachime (court nobles).

sen.j: もっとも、政治的な理由や天皇個人との関係を理由として公卿でも昇殿が許されない事例もあり、そういう人々を「地下の上達部」と称した。
sen.e: However, from political reasons or because of the connection with an emperor, some people were not given shoden even if they were court nobles, and such people were called "Jige no Kandachime".

However, for political reasons or because of the relationship with the emperor, some people were not given shoden even if they were kugyo, and such people were called "Jige (lower class nobles) no Kandachime."
sen.cmt: from→for としました。connection→relationship としました。an→the としました。「公卿」ファイル内統一のため、kugyo としました。「地下」を補足しました。ピリオドを " " の中に入れました。
sen.e: However, for political reasons or because of the relationship with the emperor, some people were not given shoden even if they were kugyo, and such people were called "Jige (lower class nobles) no Kandachime."

sen.j: 代表的な例として東宮居貞親王の尚侍・藤原綏子と密通した源頼定は居貞親王（三条天皇）即位後に既に公卿であるにも関わらず昇殿が許されなかった（『大鏡』）。
sen.e: To give a representative example, MINAMOTO no Yorisada, who committed adultery with FUJIWARA no Suishi, a shoji (Principal Handmaid) of Togu Imperial Prince Okisada, was not allowed to enter the Imperial Court in spite of the fact that he was already a kugyo after Imperial Prince Okisada was enthroned (Sanjo Emperor) ("Okagami"[the Great Mirror]).

To give a representative example, MINAMOTO no Yorisada, who had committed adultery with FUJIWARA no Suishi, a shoji (Principal Handmaid) of Crown Prince Okisada, was not allowed to enter the Imperial Court in spite of the fact that he was already a kugyo after Imperial Prince Okisada had been enthroned (Emperor Sanjo) ("Okagami" [the Great Mirror]).
sen.cmt: Togu Imperial Prince→Crown Prince としました。Sanjo Emperor→Emperor Sanjo としました。スペースを追加しました。
sen.e: To give a representative example, MINAMOTO no Yorisada, who had committed adultery with FUJIWARA no Suishi, a shoji (principal handmaid) of Crown Prince Okisada, was not allowed to enter the Imperial Court in spite of the fact that he was already a kugyo by the time Imperial Prince Okisada was enthroned (Emperor Sanjo) ("Okagami" [the Great Mirror]).

sen.j: また、後世には地下家の者が従三位以上に達しても昇殿を許されない慣例が成立した。
sen.e: In later years a custom was established that shoden was not given to members of the Jige-ke (Jige family) even if they reached jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
In later years it became an established custom that shoden was not given to members of Jige family even if they reached jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) or above.
sen.cmt: a custom was established that→it became an established custom that としました。the Jige-ke (Jige family)→Jige family としました。or above を追加しました。
sen.e: In later years it became an established custom that shoden was not given to members of Jige family even if they reached jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) or above.

sen.j: 一方、四位・五位の者が昇殿を認められるには昇殿宣旨を受ける必要があった。
sen.e: On the other hand, it was necessary for people in Shi (Fourth Rank)/goi (Fifth Rank) to receive a shoden senji (imperial decree) in order to have their shoden granted.
On the other hand, it was necessary for people in Shii (Fourth Rank)/goi (Fifth Rank) to receive a shoden no senji in order to have their shoden granted.
sen.cmt: Shi→Shii としました。（用語統一リストの位階の訳語を参考に）「昇殿宣旨」ファイル内統一のため shoden no senji とし、「宣旨」の補足は既出のため削除しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, it was necessary for people in Shii (Fourth Rank)/goi (Fifth Rank) to receive a shoden no senji in order to have their shoden granted.

sen.j: 殿上人・雲客と呼び、昇殿を許されない地下人との間に明確な区別があり、公家社会における身分基準の基本とされた。
sen.e: There was a clear-cut distinction between people called tenjobito (high-ranking courtiers who were allowed to enter the Imperial Palace) and Jigenin (court officials who were not Tenjobito) whose shoden was not permitted, which was a basic standard of social status in a court noble society.

There was a clear-cut distinction between people called tenjobito (high-ranking courtiers who were allowed to enter the Imperial Palace) or Unkaku (same meaning as tenjobito) and Jigenin (court officials who were not Tenjobito) whose shoden was not permitted, which was a basic standard of social status in a court noble society.
sen.cmt: 「雲客」訳もれのため、追加しました。
sen.e: There was a clear-cut distinction between people called tenjobito (high-ranking courtiers who were allowed to enter the Imperial Palace) or Unkaku (same meaning as tenjobito) and Jigenin (court officials who were not Tenjobito) whose shoden was not permitted, which was a basic standard of social status in a court noble society.

sen.j: なお、殿上人にも例外があり、六位蔵人はその職務上の必要から昇殿宣旨を受けられた（この場合、蔵人所が申請を行って宣旨を得た）。
sen.e: There was an exception among tenjobito that Rokui-Kurodo (kurodo in the Sixth Rank) could receive a shoden senji because performing their duties needed it (in this case the Kurodo dokoro [Office of Imperial Household Logistics] applied for shoden to obtain a senji).

There was an exception among tenjobito that Rokui no Kurodo could receive a shoden no senji because it was necessary to perform their duties (in this case the Kurodo dokoro [Office of Imperial Household Logistics] applied for shoden to obtain a senji).
sen.cmt: 「六位蔵人」ファイル内統一のため訳語変更し、既出のため補足を削除しました。「昇殿宣旨」ファイル内統一のため shoden no senji としました。「職務上の必要から」表現を変えました。スペースを削除しました。
sen.e: There was an exception among tenjobito that Rokui no Kurodo could receive a shoden no senji because it was necessary to perform their duties (in this case the Kurodo dokoro [Office of Imperial Household Logistics] applied for shoden to obtain a senji).

sen.j: また、摂関家などの有力者の子や孫は蔭位に基づく小舎人の資格で昇殿が許された。
sen.e: Children and grandchildren of influential persons were allowed to enter an imperial court in the capacity of kodoneri based on the Oni system.

Children and grandchildren of influential persons were allowed to enter denjo no ma in the capacity of Kodoneri (Minor Officer) based on the Oni system (the automatic promotion system in which the persons at the age of 21, whose parents are from Imperial to the fifth rank or whose grandparents are upper than third rank, are conferred an Imperial title).
sen.cmt: an imperial court→denjo no ma としました。（「昇殿」の意味から判断）「小舎人」を補足し、頭文字を大文字としました。「蔭位」を補足しました。（用語検索より）
sen.e: Children and grandchildren of influential persons were allowed to enter denjo no ma in the capacity of Kodoneri (Minor Officer) based on the Oni system (the automatic promotion system in which the persons at the age of 21, whose parents are from Imperial to the fifth rank or whose grandparents are upper than third rank, are conferred an Imperial title).

sen.j: これを童殿上（わらべでんじょう）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: These children were called warawa tenjo.
These children were called warabe denjo.
sen.cmt: 「童殿上」読みを原文どおりに修正しました。
sen.e: These children were called warabe denjo.

sen.j: なお、犯罪などに問われると除籍（じょじゃく）処分によって昇殿が停止されて殿上の間にあった簡が撤去された。
sen.e: If persons were accused of crime and so on, they were given jyojyaku-shobun; their names were removed from a record, their shoden were canceled and the kan (board) with their names on in the Denjo no ma was removed.

If persons were accused of crime and so on, they were given jojaku shobun: their names were removed from a record, their shoden were canceled and the kan with their names on in the Denjo no ma was removed.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。既出のため、(board)を削除しました。 jyojyaku-shobun→jojaku shobun としました。セミコロンをコロンとしました。
sen.e: If persons were accused of crime and so on, they were given jojaku shobun: their names were removed from a record, their shoden were canceled and the kan with their names on in the Denjo no ma was removed.

sen.j: このため、除籍処分を「簡を削る」とも称した。
sen.e: Therefore, such punishment was called " kan-pruning".
Therefore, such punishment was also called "kan-pruning."
sen.cmt: also を追加しました。スペースを削除しました。ピリオドを " " の中に入れました。
sen.e: Therefore, such punishment was also called "kan-pruning."

sen.j: また、一度除籍を受けた者は処分が撤回・赦免されない限りは官位の補任を受けられなかったため、その前に再度昇殿が認められる必要があった。
sen.e: People who were once given punishment of jyoseki could not be appointed any official court rank as long as the punishment was canceled/pardoned, so that they had to have their shoden granted again before appointment.

People who were once given jojaku shobun could not be appointed any official court rank unless the punishment was canceled/pardoned, so that they had to have their shoden granted again before appointment.
sen.cmt: ファイル内統一のため、punishment of jyoseki→jojaku shobun としました。as long as→unless としました。
sen.e: People who were once given jojaku shobun could not be appointed any official court rank unless the punishment was canceled/pardoned, so that they had to have their shoden granted again before appointment.

sen.j: これを還殿上（かえりでんじょう）・還昇（かんしょう/げんしょう）と呼んだ。
sen.e: This was called kaeri-denjo or kansho/gensho.
This was called kaeri-denjo or kansho/gensho.
This was called kaeri-denjo or kansho/gensho.

sen.j: 宇多天皇の時代には殿上人は30名前後であったが、院政期には内裏・院御所ともに急増した。
sen.e: In Emperor Uda era there were approximately thirty denjobito, however they rapidly increased in number in the dairi/ingosho (the retired Emperor's court) in the Insei (rule by the retired Emperor) period.

In Emperor Uda era there were approximately 30 tenjobito, however they rapidly increased in number both in the dairi and ingosho (the retired Emperor's court) in the Insei (rule by the retired Emperor) period.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字に修正しました。denjobito→tenjobito としました。（ファイル内統一のため）in the dairi/ingosho→both in the dairi and ingosho としました。
sen.e: In Emperor Uda era there were approximately 30 tenjobito, however they rapidly increased in number both in the dairi and ingosho (the retired Emperor's court) in the Insei (rule by the retired Emperor) period.

sen.j: このため、後鳥羽天皇は退位時にこれまでの慣例であった在位中の昇殿をそのまま院御所に持ち込む規定を取りやめて80名近い殿上人を44名に削減する「リストラ」を断行している。
sen.e: Therefore, Emperor Gotoba, by canceling a rule of bringing the l shoden at his reign into the ingosho, which had been a custom, performed "restructuring" at his abdication, reducing nearly eighty tenjobito to forty-four.

Therefore, Emperor Gotoba, by canceling a rule of bringing the shoden in his reign into the ingosho, which had been a custom, performed "restructuring" at his abdication, reducing tenjobito from nearly 80 to 44.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。"l" を削除しました。at→in としました。reducing nearly eighty tenjobito to forty-four→reducing tenjobito from nearly 80 to 44 としました。
sen.e: Therefore, Emperor Gotoba, by canceling a rule of bringing the shoden in his reign into the ingosho, which had been a custom, performed "restructuring" at his abdication, reducing tenjobito from nearly 80 to 44.

sen.j: これはその一方で院近臣を信頼できる側近・能吏に絞り込む効果もあり、院政運営の都合もあった。
sen.e: This also had an effect of limiting In no Kinshin (retired Emperor's courtiers) to reliable close advisers/able officials, which was necessary to the Insei management.
This also had an effect of limiting In no Kinshin (retired Emperor's courtiers) to reliable close advisers and able officials, which was necessary to the Insei management.
This also had an effect of limiting In no Kinshin (retired Emperor's courtiers) to reliable close advisers and able officials, which was necessary to the Insei management.

sen.j: また、承徳2年（1098年）には源義家の院昇殿が、天承2年（1132年）には平忠盛の内昇殿が認められ、武士の時代の到来を告げる画期となった。
sen.e: In 1098 MINAMOTO no Yoshiie's in-shoden (access to the retired emperor in the imperial court) was granted, and in 1132 TAIRA no Tadamori's nai-shoden (to be admitted to the inner Court) was granted, which were ground-breaking events telling the arrival of Samurai Age.

In 1098 MINAMOTO no Yoshiie's in-shoden (access to the retired emperor in the imperial court) was granted, and in 1132 TAIRA no Tadamori's nai-shoden (to be admitted to the inner Court) was granted, which were epoch-making events telling the arrival of Samurai Age.

In 1098, MINAMOTO no Yoshiie was granted in-shoden (access to the retired emperor in the imperial court), and in 1132, TAIRA no Tadamori was granted nai-shoden (access to the inner Court); these landmark events heralded the era of the samurai.
